name: Go, Ruby, Python, C Web and Software Development
tagline: Building well designed, highly useful, functional, web applications, and backend services on *NIX OSes since 1995.
body:
![Go language](http://www.gophercon.com/assets/img/logo.png "Go language")
![Ruby language](http://readwrite.com/files/files/files/hack/images/ruby_logo_1210.png "Ruby language")
![Rails web framework](http://sylvansocial.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/RailsLogo-200px-150x150.png "Ruby on Rails")

### `whoami`

I'm a software developer who has been designing, building, configuring, tuning, deploying, and maintaining *NIX based servers and web applications using C, Java, Python, Ruby, and most recently using Go.

I built my first server for money in 1995 written in C, running on FreeBSD 2.x. It was a set of CGI scripts which drove a database-powered radio station website. I've worked on much larger backend systems and web applications since then in Java, Python, Ruby, and now I'm converting critical parts of a large Ruby on Rails 3.2 codebase to Go's Revel with great success. It's been so successful, in fact, that I will be going into maintenance mode so I have part-time availability to work on other projects. See *Availability* section below.

### Availability

I will be available (as of Monday September 23, 2013) up to 20 hours per week to work on your Ruby on Rails, Go or a greenfield project. 

### Capabilities

Below is a quick list of what I could do for you:

* Adding functionality to your Ruby on Rails or Sinatra web app
* Fixing bugs in your Ruby on Rails or Sinatra web app
* Migrating critical parts of your Ruby/Rails or Python/Django web apps to a language/runtime/framework that can utilize multi-core servers better, e.g. Go/Revel.
* Building a fresh web application or REST API for your using Go/Revel.

While my core skills are on the Go, Ruby, Python, and C backends, I am fully capable of working on maintaining CSS, Javascript (Ember, Knockout, Angular, jQuery), and automating web asset distributions on CDNs.

![EmberJS](http://cdn.tutsplus.com/net.tutsplus.com/uploads/2013/07/ember-resources-preview.jpg "Ember Javascript") ![KnockoutJS](http://learn.knockoutjs.com/Content/App/icon.png "Knockout Javascript") ![AngularJS](http://ih3.redbubble.net/image.13973377.8604/fc,140x140,white.u8.jpg "Angular Javascript") ![jQuery](https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-7SCyYFFnd4Q/TYRdcZzO0pI/AAAAAAAAAL4/7defbkHW6jg/s1600/jquery-logo.jpg "jQuery Javascript") 

### Contact

Email me [gorubydev@gmail.com](mailto:gorubydev@gmail.com) to find out how I could assist your software project.
